request_pathways.name: Authorization to Release Protected Health Information

access_pathway.primary_pathway_description: Patients use a generic Authorization to Release Protected Health Information form that serves both patient self-access and third-party release, with 'Patient/Guardian/Legal Rep' as one of eight purpose checkboxes.

red_flags: Witness signature line present with no explanation of when required
Blanket ID attachment requirement for all requestors, not just representatives
MyChart guide states fees for 'search and duplication' for patient requests — search fees not permitted under HIPAA for patient access
Prepayment required before records release per MyChart guide
bright_spots: Spanish-language form available as full professional translation with bilingual headers
Five delivery methods offered: mail, MyChart, fax, encrypted email, other
Three distinct request pathways: PDF form, MyChart portal, Ciox eRequest
Explicit reference to HIPAA Right of Access (45 CFR §164.524)
Multi-facility contact directory covering 9 MUSC locations with complete phone, fax, and email info
Abstract record type clearly defined to help patients understand scope options

findability.rationale: Level 4: Easy to find with a basic web search or simple site navigation; the medical records page links directly to the form at a clean, descriptive URL with no access barriers.

technical_accessibility.rationale: Level 4: Mostly digital — MyChart provides a fully electronic request pathway, and the PDF form can be submitted via fax or email, but the PDF itself has zero fillable fields requiring print-and-handwrite completion.

content_design.rationale: Level 4: Well-organized with logical flow and helpfully defined record type options, but marred by dense legal disclosure text, an intimidating opening warning, and mixed plain/legal language.

patient_centeredness.rationale: Level 3: A patient can use the process but it wasn't designed for them — the generic third-party release form requires patients to fill in their own name as both patient and recipient, with patient access as one of eight purpose checkboxes.

compliance.rationale: Level 3: Several requirements beyond what HIPAA mandates for patient access — witness signature line, blanket ID requirement, SSN request, and the MyChart guide's mention of search fees and prepayment that may exceed permitted fee limits.

overall.summary: MUSC Health makes forms easy to find and offers multiple pathways including MyChart and a Spanish-language version, but the generic third-party authorization form, non-fillable PDF, and concerning fee/prepayment practices keep it from a higher grade.
